page.title: 02THE OLD PEOPLES HOME
page.content: There are 5 separate flats, housing 41 old people. We talked to some of the residents. One was very excited because it was bath night on Tuesdays! Another, who was 92 years old, remembered seeing a motor car for the first time. It was open-topped and kept stuttering and stopping going up a hill. A former teacher told us she used to cycle 9 miles each way to school, until she was knocked off her bicycle. A much-appreciated resident was the one who cheered the others up with jokes and stories. All the residents have jobs in the Home, like laying the table or washing up. They like it there because the food is good and would not like to live in Cambridge on account of the noise and bustle of too many people.
